item.title: BallAR
item.description: Title screen. Summary Ramsey and I were invited to participate in the Google AR Core Game Jam that took place in September of 2019 in Los Angeles. We made a multiplayer AR tennis type game where the room becomes a ball court. First the player must scan the room, and then enter each players names. Then the game begins! Each player’s name is called, and must take turns hitting the virtual ball.

item.title: Bunny Blur
item.description: Initial sketch. Summary In the world of cut throat bunny street racing, where do you stand? Bunny Blur is a work-in-progress stand alone car racing arcade game. I am experimenting with storytelling through the custom dashboard and the arcade cabinet itself. The game is influenced heavily by personal experience playing 80’s racing arcade games, goofy retro cartoons, and the Fast and Furious franchise. The intent here is to make a fun and engaging racing game that plays with the line between physical and digital experiences.
